data: Peter Nemethy Professor Emeritus Of Physics Ph.D. 1968 (physics), B.A. (summa cum laude) 1962 (physics), Columbia. Experimental elementary particle physics, particle astrophysics. External Affiliations American Physical Society. Fellowships/Honors Golden Dozen Teaching Award, New York University, 1993 and 1998 Multiplicative versus additive muon conservation, with V. W. Hughes. Comments on Nuclear and Particle Physics , 10. 1981. 147. TPC tracking inside a Cerenkov detector, with Kotcher, D. Nesic, T. Edberg, P. Oddone, L. Baksay, R. Magahiz, Z. Egyed and R. Kofler. Nuclear Instruments and Methods , A283. 1989. 578. Observation of the top quark, with the D0 Collaboration. Physical Review Letters , 74. 1995. 2632. Peter Nemethy Professor Emeritus Of Physics peter.nemethy@nyu.edu 726 Broadway, Room 851 Phone: (212) 998-7747 Experimental Elementary Particle Physics Experimental elementary particle physics , studies the basic building blocks of matter and their interactions. The NYU group is involved in both accelerator based and non-accelerator particle physics experiments. Please visit the group's Kyle Cranmer Experimental Particle Physics Andy Haas Experimental Particle Physics Allen Mincer Experimental Particle Physics Peter Nemethy (Retired);Emeritus Professor of Physics Experimental Particle Physics
